channel.title: ::pure command problems

item.title: ::pure command problems
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“lancerRR, post:6, topic:408356”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=509638.msg3697668#msg3697668 date=1312546950]
^No, that’s totally wrong kid.
[/quote]

Don’t see you suggesting anything other than removing the int.

I do believe this is the help forum? And I, am trying to help :)[/quote]

Here’s the working version of your command,

		if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
			if (c.inWild()) {
				c.sendMessage("You can't do this here.");
				return;
			}
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((140333), 0);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 2);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 3);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 4);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 6);
		}

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure command problems
item.dc:creator: @lancerRR lancerRR
item.description:
@lancerRR wrote:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { { if (c.inWild()) return; } else { c.getPA().addSkillXP((140333), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((403332), 6); } }

Try that, not 100% it will work, but give it a try…

Also, you could add c.sendMessage(“Whatever you want to say”);
after c.inWild - that would make it give a message if they tried to use the command in the wildy 0.0

Sorry if this doesn’t work >_<

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure command problems
item.dc:creator: @jordan_dymond jordan_dymond
item.description:
@jordan_dymond wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:2, topic:408356”] if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure")) { c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99) + 5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); }

Why do you have ‘int i = 0;’? it does nothing.[/quote]
it was in the server when i got it lol

Read full topic

			c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0);

			c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6);
			c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99) + 5;
			c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
			c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
		}

item.title: ::pure command problems
item.dc:creator: @jordan_dymond jordan_dymond
item.description:
@jordan_dymond wrote:

hey guys for some reason when people type ::pure when they start its not giving them the stats heres my command /*if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pure”) && c.puremaster == 0) {
int i = 0;
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6);
c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
c.puremaster = 1;
}

any help please post a comment
